website_summaries.verdict: Similar in many respects to the SKIL, this table saw is a lightweight, affordable alternative for those who want a high-end DIY tool.
cons: (Stand is available at an additional cost.)

customer_reviews.title: Perfect saw for general home use and small cabinet making needs
customer_reviews.text: When my 25-year-old bench-top Craftsman saw (10") finally died (burnt out bearings), I researched all the current crop of portable saws. I was leery of going with the 8-1/4" bladed saw, but now I couldn't be happier. The DeWalt is stable, powerful, and accurate. The rack-and-pinion fence adjustment is rock-solid and the integrated measurement bar is accurate enough for 95% of all my work. Only when I needed things cut to less than 1/32 accuracy did I need to micro-adjust with a measuring stick. The smaller blade size never caused difficulty and indeed, it allows for higher RPMs, meaning a cleaner cut through most material.
customer_reviews.author: TRAIL_DUDE

customer_reviews.title: Love this saw!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing! For my first table saw project, I built a mobile work bench for it with a folding out feed. I need to get some dust collection built into the cart and I’ll be set.
customer_reviews.author: Dad Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Check blade, riving knife, fence alignment.
customer_reviews.text: I've only had the chance to make a few cuts on this thing. So far, it seems pretty solid. The blade was out of square by ~0.5-1 degree. Fairly simple to adjust. Although they put some of the adjustment screws in awkward spots. The riving knife is also out of alignment. Have yet to get that tried up, but it's close enough right now to not be an issue. The fence was also out of alignment. Needless to say, out of the box I had to do some minor adjustments. Other than that, it seems like a quality saw.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler S.

customer_reviews.title: Sexy
customer_reviews.text: One sexy machine. First table saw ive owned i love it. So after about a month of having it. And using it maybe 5 or 6 times. The top coating is already scratched. And I haven’t used any sleds or jigs or anything just the miter gauge that came with it.
customer_reviews.author: Arturo

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I am truly impressed with the quality and features of the DWE7485. The rack pinion adjustment for the fence, the side handle, tools, the spring loaded kickback mount...and its fairly easy to carry. I just got done ripping sections of Brazilian Angico hardwood. The saw went through it like a hot knife through butter! This is a bargain at $299. I highly recommend this table saw!
customer_reviews.author: chrisk

customer_reviews.title: perfect. Great value and performance. Read manual.
customer_reviews.text: A little difficulty figuring out rail to keep wood straight-needed to make an adjustment to correct it but if you read the manual- which you should- it was much clearer. I love it more and more every time I use it 💕
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Prather

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed *!#
customer_reviews.text: Everything needed adjustment. The riving knife is not aligned with the blade and a normal size hand with a allen wrench is impossible to get into the space to make the adjustment - so forget using the riving knife. It arrived with copious nicks in the finish on the table.
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: Love this saw!
customer_reviews.text: This is my main table saw and I love it! It cuts very well and quickly! I move this from below my work bench and it is light enough to do so with ease. I like the dust collection possibility and can't wait to hook up to a collection system. I don't believe it can accommodate a dado style blade but I was still able to make accurate dado style cuts without one. The blade stops quickly after the easy to use shutoff button and starts with a long press of the start button. It accommodates a crosscut sled easily as well.
customer_reviews.author: R. Spires

customer_reviews.title: Can't review because not all parts were sent.
customer_reviews.text: Looks like a great saw but I can't review it since I just realized that the blade guard, after assembling the stand, was not included. So, now I have to disassemble the stand (which will be a pain) and pack it all back in the box to send back. MAJOR disappointment and MAJOR waste of time. Looks like I'll be looking for a saw from a different company now.
customer_reviews.author: Steve B.

customer_reviews.title: Loving It
customer_reviews.text: I had a tablesaw that was of a cheap store brand model. i bought this because I needed something a bit better. This thing is AWESOME. The fence moves very smooth. The power button is in a great spot. The miter slots and gauge fit very nicely together. It is such a great saw that I built a table for it with it.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn M Clarady

customer_reviews.title: Good tool..didn't hold up more than a year...still under warranty....but what a hassle to replace.
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy with this product.... The saw is a workhorse when ripping boards. I even rip doors on this thing...it surprisingly accurate. It could be even more precise with a little tuning. The depth of the blade is the only adjustment that doesn't seem quite as steady and reliable as full size table saw. My biggest complaint is that it stopped working in the middle of an important job after only a year from purchase. Customer service was somewhat helpful, but I have to ship the whole tool back for replacement which is incredibly inconvenient. The cost was a little too high for comparative to tool quality.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner/job site table saw
customer_reviews.text: If you need a beginner table saw, or a job site table saw, this is a good choice. It's well built, and works very well if you know how to adjust it properly. Check some videos on YouTube on how to adjust a table saw properly (my fence was completely off, so was the blade angle). You do have to re-adjust from time to time, but no git deal here. The only con for me is the lack of "official" support to dado blades (but you can get away with multiple cuts). Overall it's very good purchase, and for the price? no brainer! I did build a table around it, that opens another realm of possibilities...
customer_reviews.author: Fernando

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I checked set up out the box, with nothing found out of adjustment. I had to trim 1/8" off 6' foot of pine trim which saw did great with stock blade. Very happy with this saw. The saw ran well on long extension cord but much better on a 20 amp rated outlet. When packing up, the manual drawing could have been better, took me 10 minutes to figure out where all accessory go..after forgetting where they came from! One niggle would be the power cord sticks straight out instead of angled to help with wrapping up cord without a large bend in base of cord.
customer_reviews.author: Bug Zapper

customer_reviews.title: I'm very happy with this saw. Replace the Stock Blade Day 1
customer_reviews.text: After a great deal of research I purchased this saw based on the comments regarding the fence. I don't have the room in my garage to allow me to have a regular table saw setup so I was looking for a substitute. This saw fits the bill perfectly for me. Plenty of power for my hobbyist needs and the dust collection system is pretty effective. I followed the suggestions of other reviewers and replaced the stock blade day 1 with a Diablo combination blade which rips and cross-cuts very smoothly. I'm very happy with this saw.
customer_reviews.author: Rich M.

customer_reviews.title: Great compact saw
customer_reviews.text: My only regret about this saw is not buying it sooner. I didn't have to make any adjustments whatsoever after setup; everything was spot on. I really like the design of the fence which makes doing thin cuts easier and safer, and the rack-and-pinion system works flawlessly. The saw cuts very cleanly and quickly. It doesn't allow use of dado blades, but for me that's a minor issue. As with any compact table saw, you definitely need an extension table when working with larger pieces. Mounted on the DeWalt rolling stand makes it a breeze for moving around or transporting.
customer_reviews.author: HokieFan

customer_reviews.title: What a piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: Was not aware that there was any assembly required.5 hours later I’m still not done Big mistake
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Made for work
customer_reviews.text: My Bosch table saw finally gave up, after 4 years of abuse flipping house after house she died.... Coronavirus made it hard to find a replacement, but eventually I bought a metabo. I won't slam it but I returned it as soon as my DeWalt showed up! DeWalt makes great tools for the tradesmen. This saw is powerful and set up in a way that makes it easy to use. I love the fence, a push tool is handy and it rips it up. Quit shopping around, if you actually work for a living and use tools, buy it!
customer_reviews.author: BotchedBoy

customer_reviews.title: Use stand shipping carton.
customer_reviews.text: The shipping carton used to ship the stand - it comes in handy. After removing all the parts from the carton, lately replace the packing material and close the box - set aside. After assembling the stand, you are instructed to place the saw upside down on a non scratch surface. Guess what? The stand carton is a great supportive surface on which to place the saw and it is at a convenient height (not perfect) to finish the assembly. P.S. I am having too much fun with this saw and will take time later to make other comments.
customer_reviews.author: chief

customer_reviews.title: Pretty sure I was sold a defective refurbished item without it being listed as such
customer_reviews.text: The gear rod that lifted the blade up and down kept skipping when moving it down like it was stripped. It seems like it had been previously used and possibly a refurbished item but there was no mention of that.i needed this for a project that was due and needless to say I was not happy with the length of time it took to get, and the manner in which it had to be returned.
customer_reviews.author: Tacomycat

customer_reviews.title: Terrible miter guage, missing parts
customer_reviews.text: The miter guage is garbage. There is so much slop in the track you literally cannot use it for any cut. It's likely a kickback hazard to use the included miter guage at all. They would be better off leaving it out completely. Great saw, but factor the cost of a new miter guage into the price because you will need one if its anything like mine. My saw also came missing several of the screws required for assembly. Dewalt support sent replacements, but half the parts they sent were wrong.
customer_reviews.author: ken27560

customer_reviews.title: Nearly perfect jobsite table saw!
customer_reviews.text: PERFECT! Except the miter gage is sloppy as all get out. I wrapped the bottom and sides in a single strip of vinyl tape to take up the slop. And be sure to check adjust all zero's. It was off on both the bevel and the fence by a hair. I wish Dewalt made an outfeed table for it. One that also attached to the topside of the saw for portability.... guess I'll have to make one with this great little jobsite tablesaw!
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Perfect out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Quick comments - This is perfect for the average person or contractor on the job. For those who make a living as a wood worker, get a cabinet saw period. I am a hobbyist and this is all I need. Now, for the accuracy, dead on out of the box. I changed the blade out with a "Freiorwuouououweoruweod" blade, you all know what I am saying. No after blade replacement adjustments needed. The fence is the best part. Oh and every single attachment has a holder so you won't lose stuff. The base is crazy sturdy and solid. Not wobbly like other bases I have seen. Awesome tool.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Handyman

customer_reviews.title: Quality saw
customer_reviews.text: This saw is so easy to move around. Very portable and yet stable when it's time to make some cuts. It is much more accurate than my last contractor saw, easier to get a 90 degree cut and has much less play in the miter gauge slots than other saws. It has a great fence... it felt a little flimsy but has proven to be durable and versatile. It has plenty of power and accepts dado stacks and has safety options. I was hoping for a larger table surface as I'm not a contractor but I haven't found a cut that I wanted to make that I couldn't do. In my opinion, it's a very good saw.
customer_reviews.author: pelican thunder

customer_reviews.title: X3 legs the same length, and one that is 3" too long!
customer_reviews.text: Tried to contact company on Dec 31st (Monday) afternoon, & DeWalt was off for New Years. Hopefully I can reach someone come Wednesday (bad luck for me all around) as I am dead in the water 2nd to the NEW right-out-of-the-box table saw that needs to be level having 4 legs all the same length... Duh! Darn "Made in China Again" - thanks for the quality control China... NOT!!!! Intend to follow-up, and see how long it will take to get the correct part now. Hopefully I will not have to return the whole thing for one part too! Oh, and will see how the table saw works out too.
customer_reviews.author: Slim

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tablesaw
customer_reviews.text: All of my family has been impressed with this table saw: it feels like a full size table saw and yet is extremely portable and can be wheeled throughout the house through regular 32 inch doors. Zero complaints so far after ripping about 100 boards. Extremely well designed (e.g. every attachment has a place to store safely on the machine) and everything was accurate/square on arrival (no adjustments required before use). My teenage kids assembled the saw with no problems and said it was straight forward.
customer_reviews.author: John D. Paden

customer_reviews.title: I can build all the things!
customer_reviews.text: This Table Saw has been a rock star for me. It is very reasonably priced with minimum setup. I had it up and running within an hour of delivery. The surface is flat and stable. The legs are easy to extend and retract but very solid. The built in measuring stick has proven to be very reliable. Adjusting the position of the guide is very easy and precise. I can easily adjust by 1/32". To date I have used this Table Saw to build a very larger entertainment center, computer desk, shelves, and various other small wood working projects. It has reliably cut straight and clean through cedar, MDF, and plywood boards.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur A.

customer_reviews.title: Tough to go wrong with DeWalt
customer_reviews.text: Miter gauge has definitely been updated. NOT the cheapskate edition. Unboxing, the stand and accessories weigh as much as the saw. Have not cut yet but have little doubt this guy will slice and dice with precision.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Must have this
customer_reviews.text: Warning- if this your first table saw like me, this may cause a sleep deficit due to the numerous applications. The speed is very impressive - the 25 tooth blade rips and crosscuts through pine like butter. I will eventually get a 40 tooth blade, but I see no reason to yet. The price is amazing here as well.
customer_reviews.author: JAccount

customer_reviews.title: Best investment I’ve made for my job.
customer_reviews.text: This saw instantly made money once I added it in my jobs. I was able to rip boards to spec with ease and made rabbets like a pro. Cross cutting requires and good sled and some precision tuning on your part but it won’t let you down! A few tricks and tips on YouTube will expand your knowledge of what this saw can potentially do and earn for you. I can’t say enough good things about it. It’s a beast. And worth the money. I did get a thin kerf finishing blade for finish cuts, the blade that comes with it is a beast for dimensional lumber and cuts like butter! The mitre gauge sucks. We all know that. Lol.
customer_reviews.author: Gymtwitch89

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for building
customer_reviews.text: For jobsite building this is a must. Every woodworker knows how invaluable a table saw is. I would by no means use this for making extreme precision cuts for fine furniture or joinery, but for building it does what you need. I especially love how everything(push stick,kick back claws, fence) store/fold into the machine for easy transportation. It is heavy, majority of people will need a helper to lift this into the back of a truck. There are a few pieces of plastic, but majority of the frame is metal. If it is in the budget i would advise a stationary table saw by JET or Powermatic for projects that require little to no variance in precision.
customer_reviews.author: ClaytonTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Robust and Accurate
customer_reviews.text: A great addition to my set of saws. Now I can easily cut wood and plastic for picture frames for my wife's artwork. The blade supplied only has 20 teeth, which is meant for rough construction carpentry. But blades with more teeth are readily available for fine-woodwork and plastic. (40 teeth and 60 teeth respectively). I was skeptical that a small diameter blade would do the job, but the rigid construction of the saw, and its high RPM motor work great together.
customer_reviews.author: duncan culver

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small shop
customer_reviews.text: I wasn’t expecting much out of a portable table saw but this little beauty delivers professional quality cuts in small package. It’s easy to move and rips through thick pieces with ease. The guides are easy to move and adjust plus it’s incredibly accurate for precision cuts. Not going to work if you have large timbers or long cuts but is excellent for a small wood shop. I build cutting boards and small tables, this tool has cut hours off of each project.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Roper

customer_reviews.title: Fast easy set up.
customer_reviews.text: Fast easy set up. You'll need to "dial it in" as it doesn't come perfect out of the box - lot's of YOUTUBE's on how to do that. The supplied allen wrench (1) doesn't fit all the adjustments you'll need to make. I had to remove the 'up/down' handwheel to get to the 0* blade adjustment screw and find a 4.5mm allen to make that happen. Also, search for the plans for an out-feed table, working plywood you'll need one. Other than that, love this thing!!
customer_reviews.author: Mudrat54

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tool
customer_reviews.text: I made a workbench for it. Since there is no blueprints for this anywhere, it was difficult to make a workbench to hold it perfectly. But I did it. I use it some days on a week (used today) and I absolutely love it. Building jigs/sleds and all sorts of tools for it. To point a bad thing, it came non-calibrated, which is normal. So, understand how to calibrate the blade angle, the motor angle from 0 to 45, the fence alignment, and so on. Only then start using it.
customer_reviews.author: Marco

customer_reviews.title: Great saw for small workshop!
customer_reviews.text: I have a small wood shop and this saw feels like a perfect fit for my space. It arrived decently adjusted but I spent an hour or so squaring it and dialing everything in. I am very happy with the accuracy and usability of the saw. The only weak point is the miter gage that comes with it. It's small, sloppy in the track, and has no positive stops. At some point I'll probably add a custom in-feed and out-feed table to make it easier to cross cut large pieces but otherwise I'm very happy.
customer_reviews.author: S. Kraft

customer_reviews.title: Warranty Information
customer_reviews.text: 3 year Limited Warranty. 90 Day guaranteed money back. I've had mine about 7 weeks now. No problems. Handy & reliable. Nice features & safety orientated. Good buy for the price. Be aware, it is a discontinued model DeWalt came up with newer models. Can register on-line.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon F. Bower

customer_reviews.title: Serious piece of machinery.
customer_reviews.text: This saw is no joke. It's extremely rugged, well-made for the job-site or your workshop/garage/basement. It's a little heavier than I imagined but because of how its built, can be carried & transported to where needed. It's just a very BEEFY tool.
customer_reviews.author: Loner

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to give it 5, settled for 4
customer_reviews.text: Got a great deal... but, Amazon must get these as factory 2nds- The paint or coating in the deck had a smudge, didn’t bother me but a smudge none the less- also the blade was off a smidge, 16th - 32nd, not much when doing rough cutting, but until noticed, it cost me a few pieces of white oak flooring, it adjusted easily- All in all nice cutting and portable -stows nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Carmine Junior Jr.

customer_reviews.title: The more I use it, the more I like it
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance on the reviews and I am not disappointed. The saw was dead on accurate out of the box. So far, it's handled everything we've thrown at it. Ripped a 30" piece of Maple Plywood yesterday. Not a big deal except I was thinking the maximum rip was 24". Just move the fence down to the last set of screws and voila! Ripped Oak, Maple, Cherry and other hardwoods with no problem. Very impressive for a "job site saw".
customer_reviews.author: MikeTop Contributor: Golf

customer_reviews.title: For the money this is a great portable table saw.
customer_reviews.text: I have used it to build a barn door that would have cost me 1800.00 to purchase. I am into the door about 300 dollars in wood and and hardware. 500 on the saw and 200 on the dewalt dado blades (which I love). and I have a great table saw now for all my other projects!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Table Saw
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this saw and has put it to constant use during our home renovation. As an engineer with excellent carpentry skills, he appreciates the attention to safety and convenience of the design.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Great saw but got used instead of new saw
customer_reviews.text: Table saw itself is amazing, really glad it has thick dado support, the safety features are really amazing too. Just sucks I ordered it new and get a used item. My blade looks different from everyone elses but it seems to check out as the same thing, just different paint so if you receive one where the yellow is on the body instead of the blades - you're likely getting what Dewalt actually sent (not 100% sure if mine was switched out by the previous owner but I doubt it was).
customer_reviews.author: I Like Turles

customer_reviews.title: Can't cut straight
customer_reviews.text: Hi, I can't cut straight, the board at the top is slightly shorter than the bottom at the end of the cut. The saw is at 90 degrees, parallel to the miter slot, fence is also parallel to the miter slot (I use a digital gauge) and even checked the axis of the blade but still, I get the same issue. Is it possible that the blade itself is bent (doesn't look like) or the fence is moving or bent while cutting? I paid attention to my gestures to make sure I follow the fence. Any advice would be very appreciated. I am a beginner and very confused with the table saw. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Francois D.

customer_reviews.title: It isn't a cabinet saw but it is a great garage tool.
customer_reviews.text: I still don't have a dedicated workshop area so all my tools must move and get out of the way of the cars. I like this saw a lot. The stand is nice and I haven't had any reasons to regret the purchase. If you need perfection this probably isn't the table saw for you, but you should know that before purchasing something like this anyways. My only complaint so far has been the lack of support after the cut, but I will fix that with building some tables for it in due time.
customer_reviews.author: Stupid People are Annoying

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Dewalt thought of it all when engineering this saw. The portability is great. Did not come with bags to catch shavings from the cover or the main discharge port, but that was easy to remedy with another trip to Amazon. The folding stand and wheels make this saw perfect for saving space in your garage or moving job sites. The instruction manual was awesome. I know you are thinking, “who comments on an instruction manual?” I know, but this manual was so step by step and thorough I was totally impressed. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Dono D

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very nice saw. I replaced my old Ryobi BT3000 so understandably it was like comparing a model For with a Cadillac. Cuts are fast and accurate and the rack and pinion fence is smooth and right on the money with any adjustments. Nice. The folding stand is much much easier to use than I thought it would be, taking a couple minutes at most to fold it up for transport. Adjustments were right on out of the box and the miter gauge is all metal except for the plastic adjustment knob. I'm not faulting anything with this saw and stand. Would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Very intriguing

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product. The best saw I have ever owned. Great quality and craftsmanship. Super well thought lien design makes it compact, but still able to carry all of the included accessories. The fence is solid and locks down nicely. The sturdy frame is light but heavy duty and maneuvers well with its two solid rubber wheels. Set-up and tear down literally only takes about 10secs.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy1234

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and roll around the garage where needed
customer_reviews.text: This saw has met my expectation. Easy to assemble and roll around the garage where needed. Set up and fold up are simple and not taxing at all. Table is not perfectly flat, but within my tolerance as I am not a fine furniture maker. Home repairs and upgrades and simple furniture is about the extent of it and this saw will serve me well. I immediately upgraded the blade to a 60 tooth Freud and haven't looked back. My only negative comment would be that the safety features are rather fiddly. I spent more time than should have been necessary installing the anti-kick back piece.
customer_reviews.author: stan yamada

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and powerful.
customer_reviews.text: 06/2017 - Very versatile. I replaced my porter cable hybrid saw with this and I haven't looked back. I'll follow up in a few months Update 02/19/18 - I basically used my DWE7491 for ripping, which I'm 100% happy with the results. Recently I purchased Incra's Box Joint Jig and was struggling to get accurate cuts. I found the issue was the saw table top was bowed inwards towards the blade by 1/16. I contacted DeWalt and they advised that I bring the saw to their local service center. When I got there, the guys told me the have a back log of 3 weeks Will provide an update once I hear back from the service center manager.
customer_reviews.author: WWBabe

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw
customer_reviews.text: Should have purchase along time ago. Portability is excellent. Love the tool, and it cuts like a hot knife through butter. Every tool I own is Dewalt , never fail and always work.
customer_reviews.author: Nels

customer_reviews.title: As good as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of reading to find which saw was the best. This DeWalt kept coming up. Having many DeWalt tools already, I finally spent the money to get this table saw. Very pleased with the saw. Got it with the stand which makes it really easy to store and move around. Has storage spots for all of the accessories on the machine so everything is where you need it. Great saw. Came set up very accurate right out of the box. Lots of power to easily rip through hard wood. Very pleased only wish I had purchased this saw sooner.
customer_reviews.author: nm

customer_reviews.title: Just Buy One!
customer_reviews.text: Great saw out of the box. Produces clean and precise cuts. Easy to carry and setup. This table saw is $399 at the big box stores. At $279 from Amazon, it's a no brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Road1

customer_reviews.title: Great saw and stand.
customer_reviews.text: I love this saw. My old delta motor crapped out, I looked to see how much it was to buy a new one or rebuild it. Once I realized it was goin to be about $200 I decided just to invest in a newer, more transportable one. This set up is great. The stand is sturdy and easily managed. Initial set up only took about 20 minutes. I had looked into several other saws like Bosch and Ridged. I liked the stand better on the Bosch, but I would of had to sacrifice cutting width for a better stand. In the end I went with this one and I'm very happy I did.
customer_reviews.author: Dan W.

customer_reviews.title: Quality is superior
customer_reviews.text: I had a craftsman table saw for about 10 years. When mounting holes on the saw broke I ordered this one. I knew my old saw wasn't great but I didn't realize just how much it sucked until I got this one. The quality is superior. The saw is very rigid and powerful. One of the problems I had with my old saw was getting the fence square. You don't have to worry about it with this saw. All of the accessories have a place to stow in the saw, and everything locks in well, you don't have to worry about things falling out. This is my first DeWalt tool and I'm impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great table saw!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great buy. If you're a small contractor or a dyi weekend warrior this is the table saw to have. Powerful, lightweight, durable materials, portable. Using it for 6 weeks now. Love it
customer_reviews.author: JBEAT6

customer_reviews.title: Best investment I've made so far
customer_reviews.text: This saw is amazing. I gave away my new skil table saw so I could get this one. It is infinitely better, safer, more consistent and just plain a joy to use. I like being able to pack it away so easily and set it up so fast. It doesn't have those annoying tabbed miter slots like the skil saw had. What I don't like: the top is plastic and not as smooth as I would like. Great investment in my little garage shop.
customer_reviews.author: rose nett

customer_reviews.title: The world is imperfect and it makes me sad.
customer_reviews.text: Miter gauge is similar in design to cheap table saws, but executed in a much more robust manner. My beef with this saw AND stand combo is the quality control for the stand components. One of the main frame components must not have been placed in the jig properly during manufacturing, so 2 bolt holes were in the incorrect locations, forcing me to drill additional holes to mount the table saw to the frame, and put the frame of the stand together.
customer_reviews.author: Val Stachowski

customer_reviews.title: Quality saw
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant on buying this or saving for a cabinet saw. The quality is nicer than it looks in the pictures, the table was flat but please take the time to adjust the blade and fence. I got the Lee Dw-2 zero insert with it, works perfect. I was able to dial it in precisely but took some time because im ocd about precision. I will build a full table for it with a router table on one side, and doubt i will get a cabinet saw now.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Great saw!
customer_reviews.text: Great saw especially at that price! Fence is very nice small blade actually a positive. Love the new on off switch. Powers down very quickly which is much safer. In a perfect world it would be 10 pounds lighter. I think the concept is the weight keeps it from sliding around but would like a lighter one with the ability to screw in place.
customer_reviews.author: judith ragunas

customer_reviews.title: Extremely satisfied with this saw
customer_reviews.text: Great price point. This saw is heavier than other portable contractor saws but it's hardly noticeable with the stand. Very sturdy, excellent features, The parts that will experience the most wear are metal and not plastic like some other brands. It's worth spending a little more compared to other contractor saws. It actually arrived one day early! I've used it a lot since it was delivered. It handles 2x4 stock well, It worked well with my dado blades, and the extended cutting width comes in handy. The exhaust system for the sawdust works great.
customer_reviews.author: ROSCOE PISOR

customer_reviews.title: Nice choice for most DIYers
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid tool. My cuts are precise. The sliding scale is accurate and the saw is pretty easy to use. I almost docked a star due to the poor instructions for setting the saw up, but the tool itself is very good - so I forgave the bad documentation and left it at five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Tilmer L Wright Jr

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast, I love it. The fence design is very nice and is dead on accurate out of the box. Power in motor seems great so far, ive not had an issue cut some very hard maple and it cut it like butter. The dolly is super handy, I love it.
customer_reviews.author: M. J.

customer_reviews.title: Three years out, and it's still working fine!
customer_reviews.text: I moved from my home in Houston to a house in a suburb in 2015, getting rid of a wonderful vintage table saw in the process. Soon, I found that I needed a table saw, and figured that this one might serve me well until I could afford to replace it with something better. Well, I still have it, and I use it regularly. It folds compactly and when I unfold it, everything lines up just fine. The only recommendation I would make would be to get a better miter gauge. Otherwise, it's just fine!
customer_reviews.author: Willard P.

customer_reviews.title: Every young man needs this tool.
customer_reviews.text: The best Gift I could have given my Artistic Grand Son. He has been doing a lot of wood work around the house, made Crown Mouldings around the Bathroom Mirrors.
customer_reviews.author: Alva gordon

customer_reviews.title: This is the saw to command all saws.
customer_reviews.text: This is the saw to command all saws. Of all of the DeWalt jobsite saws, this one is clearly the leader. A very well-designed tool. The runway on this model is about 3 inches longer than that of the other similar models. The stand is incredibly easy to erect and collapse and is quite sturdy when the saw is in use. The quality of the the stand, saw, and accessories is top notch; everything you would expect from a professional grade DeWalt power tool. I'm am 100% thrilled with this purchase. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: T. P.

customer_reviews.title: You either like DeWalt or you don’t. I’ve had good experiences.
customer_reviews.text: I love the fence on these. Very nice for a job site saw in my opinion. I didn’t use the stock blade but saved it in case I need to cut something nasty. I put a red thin kerf combo blade on here and it’s done everything I could ask. The stand actually works. You can fold this up and store it in the corner. Easily transportable. Throw it in the bed of your truck and go.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect level tabletop- great saw
customer_reviews.text: Almost didn't buy this saw because of the people complaining of the table top wasn't perfectly flat. I just got my saw and checked it with a straight edge and it is perfect. Also, fence perfectly aligned-no bowing, and blade perfectly 90. Only needed a 30 second adjustment to the ruler gadge for the fence width. Best saw I ever owned. Dust collection is incredible on this saw. I especially love how far the fence goes out... like 32" inches? It's ridiculously great.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Riehl

customer_reviews.title: quiet powerful performance
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased to replace an older Dewalt unit that while still functional had had better days. I'm largely a bandsaw user, but a quality table saw is a necessity around any shop, and this one qualifies as a quality purchase. I was amazed at how powerful it is, and how quiet. If you don't have the room for a full sized cabinet saw this is a great compromise.
customer_reviews.author: loucarreras

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: This was a recent, and unanticipated purchase to replace an older table saw that finally gave up the ghost. After being ticked off a having to buy it, I think it was a very good purchase. And it has been heavily field tested during our kitchen remodel, see photos of hubby, dog for scale. Easily moved, sturdy while in use, myriad adjustments for customized cuts. It’s the bomb!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Very good performer, excellent racking fence
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy base, easy to collapse and roll around. Pretty heavy, you don't want to be picking it up frequently. Excellent racking fence, good provided blade. Needed minor adjustment of blade angle on initial set up, but this is to be expected, and is holding alignment fine. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Spin

customer_reviews.title: Almost great
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for rough carpentry framing, this will work. The best feature is the easy measuring slides. The negative is trying to change blades and trying to get the blade to exactly 90 degrees --I only got to 87/88 degrees, and that bugged me A LOT (not good when trying to cut 6"x6" posts). The mobility/portability is nice. It is sturdy as well.
customer_reviews.author: NightSky

customer_reviews.title: I realized that the DeWalt seemed to be the best of all worlds
customer_reviews.text: This is the One you want! If you are reading this review you are probably trying to decide between the Bosch 4100-09 and the Dewalt DWE7491RS. After some research, I realized that the DeWalt seemed to be the best of all worlds. This newer version has the ability to accept Dado blades, though not included in the package (which it should be at this price!) and a 32 inch RIP capacity. This can do it all and it has a far superior rack and pinion fence. Go ahead and purchase this one and don't look back! Everything is solid metal! and the tires are durable plastic that wont break down on the jobsite!
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Better then what it could be at the price
customer_reviews.text: This saw did exactly what I needed it for, if you are expecting something more precise, expect to pay twice what this is. You gotta clean the think out and needs fine tuning before it can do any finishing cuts but aside from that it is better then it could be at the price
customer_reviews.author: Sean Cardamone

customer_reviews.title: Best in its class
customer_reviews.text: Upon receipt, both the fence and miter were spot on for straight cuts. Even with blade changes (good ones) adjustments are not necessary. Nice that it is ready to cut when I set it up to use it. The table and accessories are well made and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A cut above
customer_reviews.text: Nice saw, easy to set up, cuts straight. A bit of over kill with the blade shield IMHO. I like the bigger table on this model and the rack and pinion fence design. I removed the wheels and the end pieces to reduce the footprint of saw. YMMV
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this table saw. Very accurate cuts with no fussing with the fence. Just set it and cut. The only negative I can think of is the footprint. This is so the saw is very stable but it takes a lot of room. I am going to make a stationary stand in my shop for it and remove it from the rolling stand. Don't get me wrong, the rolling stand is great and I will keep it for moving the saw outside on occasion. I love that all the accessories are stored on the saw. Good distance from front of the saw to the blade too. For a portable table saw, this is the bomb!
customer_reviews.author: D. Dickinson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome table saw! Super smooth, super accurate, well built. It starts and stops smoothly - no rattling on start! Which is what my old one did. The extendable rails are a great feature to rip longer/wider cuts. The first few cuts, I was anal about measuring the cut myself because I've developed a habit to not trust the table saw measurements. Every time, it was exactly what the built in measurements said. Wow. The simple pleasures of life.
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: I sold a 250 pound Craftsman contractor saw that was 20 years old to buy this one. Likes. The fence is dead straight and the scale is right on. It locks parellel to the blade and The blade is parallel to the miter channels, and zero angle means zero. Even the supplied blade is pretty awesome. DeWalt really hit it out of the park on this one. Only thing I would change is to make the table out of steel instead of aluminum so magnetic attachments can be used.
customer_reviews.author: Sarge

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient and works great!
customer_reviews.text: I got this saw today. The cart was very easy to set up and the saw was easily attached. Within minutes it was set up and I was using it. The blade it comes with is not super high quality, but still worked good for what I needed. The saw made good fast cuts. As with there other products, DeWalt has great quality.
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: A big upgrade over my old table saw
customer_reviews.text: The primary reason I bought the Dewalt table saw is the sturdiness of the stand. The legs fold up and down easy and the saw stays stationary without fear of it moving or falling. My old table saw was a cheap Ryobi that didn't have much in the way of safety features and did not have its own stand. I haven't used it a lot yet but it appears to be accurate so far. One negative is the instructions on how to use some of the features. It took way too long to figure things out.
customer_reviews.author: Clyde Porter

customer_reviews.title: Great saw but the stand Amazon recommends for it doesn't fit.
customer_reviews.text: The saw is great. Set up in a few minutes and it's very high quality and well designed. The stand that Amazon pairs with it is not compatible though.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Gindt

customer_reviews.title: Wow ! A marvellous saw!
customer_reviews.text: Unlike my old bosch 1031 i am sooooooooooo loving this saw straight out the box,there is a reason why it i still sells expensive & highly rated because it just damn good,the features on this are tremendously remarkable cannot complain ,just love it love it love it,easy to roll in and roll out.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Quality item
customer_reviews.text: This really is a great table saw. The stand and legs are very sturdy and it’s balanced well when you move it in the hand truck position. Perfect for cutting trim or ripping lumber. Cuts are accurate. I am very happy with this saw.
customer_reviews.author: Diamond-D

customer_reviews.title: Very good addition
customer_reviews.text: This thing rips, I have no complaints. Easy start and stop button, can be set up to a 45 degree angle, comes with a push assist, removable wall for all size cuts, and wall extends to fit most every cut I've needed it for. Not super heavy, was easy to build into my workbench for easy outfeed. Good starter table saw for a first time buyer.
customer_reviews.author: Chris mckeon

customer_reviews.title: Best portable saw on the market
customer_reviews.text: This saw works flawlessly in every way. Accurate, sturdy, and very well made. I figured that straight out of the box this saw would need some adjusting and fine-tuning....I was wrong, it was perfectly accurate. All I did was change the blade out to a Freud.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Precision Instrument
customer_reviews.text: March 22, 2017 Love it so far. This is precision tool. First thing I did was build cross-cut sled and now I can go to town. Assembly: It went well, mostly you are building the stand and mounting the saw on it. The saw itself comes assembled. As mentioned in the top review, you probably want to have a 13mm socket or 13mm wrench on hand. They provide you one but it is hard to use because it is so small.
customer_reviews.author: John Martin

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SAW BAD SHIPPING
customer_reviews.text: Saw is GREAT! Package arrived with holes in the box, a completely collapsed corner and dented the stand a little. Again, GREAT SAW, terrible shipping practices. The fence on this saw is worth the cost of the saw, it is so each to use, square, and accurate. The table extends to accommodate cutting entire sheets and the fence has a flip-down support so your wood doesn’t fall under the fence when it’s extedned past the table. Couldn’t be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw
customer_reviews.text: I have needed a Table saw for a while and finally did enough research to conclude that this was the best model for me. The only thing I regret is waiting so long to purchase it. The only problem I have is that I am usually working alone so cutting a full 4x8 sheet is a bit tricky but that's my fault. I was debating between this and the Bosch and from the people I know that have the Bosch seem to like the features of my DeWalt better after looking at it.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Evans

customer_reviews.title: Largest ripping capacity
customer_reviews.text: Largest ripping capacity that i could find at the time . Nice saw that is simple to use and simple to move around ! Although one thing I did not like was the blade that came with with . Replaced Blade within a few cuts which I was okay with .
customer_reviews.author: elvache

customer_reviews.title: They have the best fence system on the market in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: I've used Dewalt tablesaws for years. They have the best fence system on the market in my opinion. I started my own cabinet business and needed a good reliable saw so I bought this one. I love this saw and would give it 5 stars but I'm not sure how well it will hold up being used hard everyday. The stand is a must, easy to set up and use and would fit through any door way and folds up nicely if space is an issue.
customer_reviews.author: David Gorrell

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this saw for several months now and have nothing bad to say about it. It is well designed and constructed. I use it in my garage and it is easily folded and stored in the corner.
customer_reviews.author: mcm

customer_reviews.title: is that I wish the rack and pinion had smaller teeth to give finer control using the fence adjustment knob
customer_reviews.text: Having been used to a RIDGID cast iron table saw, I was afraid I'd be "downgrading" my experience going to this saw. Turns out there was nothing to fear, and this is even more convenient for breakdown, setup, and transportation. Very well thought out how all the tools can be put away but kept with the saw itself. The only gripe I have, and it's minimal, is that I wish the rack and pinion had smaller teeth to give finer control using the fence adjustment knob.
customer_reviews.author: Atheris

customer_reviews.title: Great machine. Highly recommend it
customer_reviews.text: Excellent piece of equipment. I am a hobbyist but love making and fixing things. It is very portable and easy to work with. The guide system and fence is fantastic. Highly recommend. Only negative is the mitre gauge. I recommend throwing it away and buying a new one. The one that they provide is inaccurate and too small
customer_reviews.author: Richard T. Roth

customer_reviews.title: Great for light duty, but lacks power
customer_reviews.text: if you're looking for a table saw that will do everything EXCEPT cut large pieces of hardwood, you can't go wrong with this saw. great for a jobsite or *small* softwood hobbyist jobs. Unfortunately, this saw can't keep up with hardwood. The motor has trouble ripping even a 1/16" off of a 2" thick piece of maple lumber. Pair this saw with a nice blade and cut easily through any plywood or pine; but it will bog down and create uneven cuts on hardwoods even with high quality blades.
customer_reviews.author: William Calomiris

customer_reviews.title: Dead accurate.
customer_reviews.text: The fence system was dead on right out of the box. The stand made me nervous because it's such a heavy unit to sit up on its side, but that also works great. I replaced a cheaper green brand with this amazing saw and it's about as close as my shop will allow to a cabinet table saw. I love it. The blade that comes with it works great for non precise cuts
customer_reviews.author: William Kelley

customer_reviews.title: I have not used the saw nor have I checked any of the fine adjustments as other projects in bad weather prevented me ...
customer_reviews.text: . I was pleasantly surprised how little had to be assembled on the actual saw and the 20 minutes of assembly time was primarily putting the stand together which is rock solid and folds up perfectly. (Every bolt and piece fit together perfectly) if I ever assembled a second one it would probably take half the time. ..I have not used the saw nor have I checked any of the fine adjustments as other projects in bad weather prevented me from doing this. I think this saw "may be the real deal"......
customer_reviews.author: TPB2002

customer_reviews.title: Great saw for me
customer_reviews.text: Great saw for me. I have a large shop but hate keeping tools out in the open. This a perfect solution for me. It is sturdy, nicely designed does all I need. Easy to maneuver even for an old fart like me. The adjustment to the fence if fantastic. Tool storage, easy off and on for the blade guard. Look up videos on Youtube to see all the features. I am totally satisfied with this saw. One of the best purchases I have made in years. Never was a fanboy of Dewalt but guess I can't say that now.
customer_reviews.author: Roosterman

customer_reviews.title: Metric rip scale is unavailable
customer_reviews.text: Even though the manual states that a metric rip scale can be ordered from DEWALT it can not. I contacted the DEWALT chat line and got the answer call the Parts phone number. I called the parts ordering line and was put on hold for 15 minutes before they came back with the answer that there is no metric rip scale available for purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Henry S

customer_reviews.title: Off to a good start
customer_reviews.text: Thoughtful design and works well. Even the provided blade does a good job. Stand legs can be released without bending over with a bit of practice and stand is sturdy. Tool storage nice but scattered around so it takes some use before you remember where everything is. Nice lever locks and geared adjustment for the fence adjustment. All the adjustments were spot on as it came out of the box. Assembly easy with good instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Flyinglow

customer_reviews.title: FITS OUR APPLICATION
customer_reviews.text: Really like accuracy of fence adjustment. Motor has not bogged down any time it's been used. Use for all hobby and farm projects.
customer_reviews.author: Jonn Kersting

product_meta.title: DEWALT Table Saw for Jobsite, Compact, 8-1/4-Inch (DWE7485)
product_meta.description: Maximized for accuracy and capacity this DEWALT DWE7485 8-1/4 in. table saw includes on-board storage for blade guard assembly, non-through cut riving knife, anti-kickback pawls, blade change wrenches, miter gauge and push stick. The powerful DEWALT 15 amp, 5800 RPM motor allows users to complete a majority of applications. The rack & pinion fence allow for fast, easy adjustments and provides the capacity to rip 4x8 sheet goods.
feature_bullets: Portability: Compact size for ease of transportation and storage
Easy adjustments: Rack and pinion telescoping fence rails make fence adjustments fast, smooth and accurate
Variety of cuts: 24.5 inches of rip capacity for ripping 4x8 plywood or OSB sheets
Onboard storage: Onboard storage provides easy access to the site pro guarding components and push stick when not in use
Guaranteed tough: Metal roll cage ensures job site durability
